revisions.rev:
{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=1995 |Team=Northwestern Wildcats |Image=Northwestern N logo.gif |Conference=Big Ten Conference |Division= |ShortConference=Big Ten |Record=10-2 |ConfRecord=8-0 |HeadCoach=[[Gary Barnett]] |CoachRank=7 |APRank=8 |OffCoach= |DefCoach= |OScheme= |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Ryan Field (stadium)|Dyche Stadium]] |Champion= Big Ten Champions |BowlTourney=[[1996 Rose Bowl|Rose Bowl]] vs. [[1995 USC Trojans football team|USC]] |BowlTourneyResult= L 41-32 }} {{1995 Big Ten football standings}} The '''1995 Northwestern Wildcats football team''' represented [[Northwestern University]] in the [[1995 NCAA Division I-A football season|1995 NCAA Division I-A college football season]].
==Season== Northwestern finished the season with a 10-2 record. Under head coach [[Gary Barnett]], the trio of [[quarterback]] Steve Schnur, [[running back]] [[Darnell Autry]], and [[linebacker]] [[Pat Fitzgerald]] lead the Wildcats to a dramatic turnaround for the program. "Expect Victory" was the motto even as Northwestern began the season as 28-point underdogs. A shocking 17-15 season-opening win over heavily favored [[1995 Notre Dame Fighting Irish football team|Notre Dame]], along with wins over [[1995 Michigan Wolverines football team|Michigan]], 19-13, and [[1995 Penn State Nittany Lions football team|Penn State]], 21-10, catapulted the team into the national spotlight and made them media darlings. Northwestern achieved a ranking of #3 in the nation and won the [[Big Ten Conference]] title. They faced off against [[1995 USC Trojans football team|USC]] in the [[1996 Rose Bowl|Rose Bowl]] where the Wilcats' [[Cinderella (sports)|Cinderella]] season came to an abrupt halt with a 41-32 loss.
